Thanks to Stacey for suggesting this. I am back from the Palm Springs International Film Festival and will be setting up many movie dates.

( Sweden , 2008) Directed by Tom as Alfredson. Screenplay by John Ajvide Lindqvist, based on his novel. Cast: Kare Hedebrant, Lina Leandersson, Per Ragnar, Henrik Dahl.

There's nothing quite like an ethereal Swedish vampire movie - with its title taken from a Morrissey song - to help you make it through the doldrums of winter. It begins with the pain of a 12-year-old boy named Oskar (Kare Hedebrandt), who is the favorite whipping boy of a particularly nasty bully. Enter the pale and empathetic Eli, (Lina Leandersson) who knows (as one of the undead) more than most about living as an outcast. Morbid, darkly humorous (don√≠t miss the overly-curious poodle), mysterious and occasionally quite bloody, Let the Right One In stands out in a year when all things vampire are hot. "as delicate, haunting and poetic a film as you're ever bound to see... a chilling fairy tale." - director Guillermo Del Toro (Cronos, Hellboy, Pan's Labryinth) 114 min.
